articles.title: DPRK Ambassador in China Urges Conclusion of Peace Treaty
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador in China Urges Conclusion of Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A press conference was called at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Tuesday as regards the statement published by the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 At the conference the DPRK ambassador briefed on the statement and referred to the fact that dialogues for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula had been held thanks to the consistent efforts of the DPRK government since the 1990s and, in this course, important bilateral and multilateral agreements were adopted.
					
					 However, the implementation of all those agreements stopped halfway or was overturned, he noted, saying that the course of the six-party talks proves that the issue can never be settled without confidence among the parties concerned.
					
					 It is our conclusion that priority should be given to building confidence between the DPRK and the United States, the parties chiefly responsible for the nuclear issue, to bring back the process for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula on track, he said, stressing the importance of the conclusion of a peace treaty between the two countries.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The conclusion of this treaty will help terminate the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. and positively promote the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula at a rapid tempo.
					
					 Talks for the conclusion of peace treaty may be held either at a separate forum as laid down in the September 19 Joint Statement or in the framework of the six-party talks for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula like the DPRK-U.S. talks now under way in view of their nature and significance.
					
					 If the parties to the Armistice Agreement sincerely hope for peace and security and the denuclearization of the peninsula, they should no longer prioritize their interests but make a bold decision to deal with the fundamental issue without delay.

articles.title: Hot Springs in Mt. Chilbo Area
articles.content:
Hot Springs in Mt. Chilbo Area
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The hot springs in Mt. Chilbo area in Myongchon County, North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK are widely used for treatment of various diseases.
					 According to the latest survey, there are 19 springs in 11 spots including Hwangjin, Taho, Manho and Sari.
					
					 Of them eleven are sulfur springs (more than 2 milligrams per liter).
					
					 Sulfur spring is potent for skin diseases, nervous system disorders, women's diseases, chronic heavy metal poisoning, digestive and urinary troubles, blood and metabolic diseases, etc. 
					
					In the area new villages including Hwangjin village and cozy dwellings have come into being to provide lodging and boarding to people who want to be treated by hot springs.

articles.title: Korean People Advance Forward with Confidence
articles.content:
Korean People Advance Forward with Confidence
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- In response to the appeal of the joint New Year editorial published by the DPRK's leading newspapers, the Korean service members and people have advanced dynamically with confidence and optimism since the beginning of the year to bring about great changes in the building of a thriving nation this year that marks the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The army and people, with the belief that led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il they will surely move up a rosy future filled with their happiness, have adorned their everyday work with merits, deeply moved by his patriotic dedication to the nation.
					
					 "Let us live not merely for today but for tomorrow!" -- this is a slogan they will as ever hold high in their work and life.
					
					 The slogan, Kim Jong Il set forth in his work published on January 14, Juche 85 (1996), encourages the people to devotedly work for the future of the nation and the happiness of posterity though they may not enjoy benefits from it.
					
					 Inspired by the revolutionary slogan, the Korean army and people could successfully conclude the ten-odd-year "Arduous March," the forced march, to advance dynamically towards a thriving nation, steadfastly defending socialism.
					
					 In the difficult years of the march the land rezoning project, a far-sighted patriotic undertaking, was finished with success along with the construction of many power stations, modern production bases and monumental edifices in different parts of the country. 
					
					 The Korean army and people, who have experienced through past years the truth that after hardship, happiness will surely come, are now working hard to open the gate to a thriving nation without fail by 2012 that marks the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Settling Fundamental Issue of DPRK-US Relations Calls for
articles.content:
Settling Fundamental Issue of DPRK-US Relations Calls for
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- It is time not only for all parties concerned but all the states concerned to opt for dealing with the fundamental issue for the purpose of achieving peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and denuclearizing it and thus make a decisive breakthrough towards settling the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S., observes Minju Joson Saturday in a signed commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 This time the DPRK government attached importance to concluding a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. as it has drawn a clear-cut conclusion on the basis of the review of the whole course of the bilateral relations.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the bilateral relations cannot be settled now that the U.S. retains a hostile aim to stifle the DPRK without fail, never coexisting with it.
					
					 Several rounds of the six-party talks had been held for the solution of the nuclear issue on the peninsula but suffered repeated frustrations and failures. This should be viewed as an inevitable product of the behavior of the U.S., the party directly responsible for solving the problem, as it has not dropped its hostility toward the DPRK. 
					
					 This is the very reason why the DPRK gave primary consideration to building confidence between the DPRK and the U.S., the parties concerned with the nuclear issue, as a precondition for injecting once again vitality into the process for denuclearizing the peninsula. 
					
					 Nothing is a more effective and constructive proposal than replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty in order to build confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. 
					
					 The replacement of the AA by a peace treaty would help bring about a signal innovation in building confidence. It is, therefore, good for having an open-minded exchange of views on the pending problems to reach agreed points and helpful to making a decisive breakthrough towards attaining peace and stability on the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Flayed
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a statement on Jan. 13 denouncing the puppet authorities' fascist suppression of civilian activists.
					 The statement referred to the fact that on the day the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office requested warrants of arrest for Ri Jong Hoe, co-executive chairman of the All-People Committee for Measures against the Murder of Evacuees in Ryongsan, and Nam Kyong Nam, chairman of the Evacuees' Association, on charges that they led the struggle for settlement of the Ryongsan tragedy.
					
					 The statement expressed resentment at this repressive action taken by the authorities after detaining Pak Rae Gun, co-executive chairman of the committee.
					
					 It is no more than a deception that the authorities had expressed "regret" through the "prime minister", the statement pointed out.
					
					 It is as good as an act of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" to incriminate those who have struggled for the settlement of the Ryongsan tragedy that resulted in grievous death of evacuees, it said, urging the authorities to stop the unreasonable suppression.

articles.title: Solution to Issue of "Comfort Women" Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Solution to Issue of "Comfort Women" Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The 900th Wednesday rally for the solution to the issue of "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army was held on Wednesday in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul.
					 It was attended by members of civic and public organizations including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea and the victims of the sexual slavery.
					
					 Speakers at the rally charged that it is 18 years since the Wednesday rally started in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul in demand of the solution to the issue and the latest one is the 900th rally but the Japanese government has not yet made any apology and reparation for its crimes related to the sexual slavery, evading the responsibility for them.
					
					 They made it clear that they would not stop the struggle till the Japanese government has fully admitted its responsibility for the crimes and redeemed them.
					
					 A statement read out at the rally demanded the Japanese government make apology and reparation to the victims as early as possible, bearing deep in mind that the responsibility for the war crimes will get heavier with the increase in the number of Wednesday rally.
					
					 It called upon the people from all walks of life to wage a more dynamic struggle to force Japan to definitely redress the crimes committed by it to the Korean nation in the past and find a solution to the issue of "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army this year. 
					
					 Solidarity rallies were held on the same day in different countries including Japan, the U.S. and Germany to expose and denounce the sexual slavery enforced by Japan in the past.

articles.title: Repression of Patriotic Activist Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Patriotic Activist Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea released a statement on Jan. 13, denouncing the puppet authorities for suppression of a young pro-reunification patriotic man.
					 The statement referred to the fact that on the day the judicial authorities sentenced Kim Song Il, a member of the solidarity, to two years in prison after trying him.
					
					 To brand Kim's admission to the solidarity and activities as "enemy-benefiting deed" and subject him to pressure by dint of the "National Security Law" is an anti-reunification behavior of totally denying the inter-Korean declarations and a suppression of the solidarity, it charged.
					
					 The statement expressed the determination to resolutely fight against the treachery of the present "government" which blocks the activity of the reunification movement organization, tossing into prison the patriotic youth who has devoted himself to the reunification of the divided country.
					
					 It demanded that the authorities unleash all the detained reunification activists including Kim.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Hailed
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Hailed
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- An international body and organizations of Guinea and Ecuador issued statements in support of the joint New Year editorial published by newspapers of the party, the army and the youth of the DPRK.
					 The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea in its statement on Jan. 9 expressed full support for the joint editorial which opens a new chapter for all the Korean people to go ahead, and stressed that the progressive political parties and organizations of all countries should make positive contribution to Korea's reunification for global peace and prosperity.
					
					 The statement held that the south Korean authorities should remove all sorts of institutional mechanisms hamstringing dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south and Japan should halt the suppression of Korean residents in Japan and do things helpful to dialogue of the Korean nation.
					
					 The Guinea-Korea Friendship Association in its statement on Jan. 7 said that unshakable is the stand of the DPRK to improve the inter-Korean relations and pave the way for national reunification on the basis of the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 Korea's reunification will be realized at once when the political parties and organizations and people from all walks of life in the north and the south of Korea are closely united with each other, irrespective of isms, the statement said.
					
					 The Guaranda, Ecuador, Association for Friendship, Culture and Solidarity with the Korean People in its statement on Jan. 5 said that Korea's reunification should be realized under the banner of the inter-Korean joint declarations, and expressed belief that the Korean people would surely achieve the reunification of the country in the near future.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Published
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Published
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial of the DPRK was brought out in bulletin by organizations of South Africa and Mexico.
					 The Group for Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa carried the full text of the joint editorial in its bulletin on Jan. 4.
					
					 The bulletin in the preface said that all the servicepersons and people of the DPRK have turned out in the general offensive to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation at any cost in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, by giving fullest play to their mental power to effect great innovations and leap forward in all fields of the society including politics, military affairs, economy, science and technology and literature and arts.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the Korean people, is standing in the van of the said drive, the bulletin noted, expressing warm welcome and full support for the DPRK's joint editorial.
					
					 The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism edited in the 34th issue of its bulletin and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea in the 49th issue of its bulletin the main contents of the joint editorial, each with a photo on the evening of fireworks and a photo on columns of mass demonstration.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Studied
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Studied
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A lecture and a seminar on the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK took place in Mexico and France on Jan. 7 and 9.
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, said in the lecture that the joint editorial of the DPRK serves as important guidelines to be held fast to by the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people as it reflected the immovable faith and iron will of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to exalt the 65th founding anniversary of the WPK as a revolutionary auspicious event worthy of special mention in the history of Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 He expressed full support and solidarity with the WPK and the Korean people in the efforts to carry out the tasks laid down in the joint editorial.
					
					 Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea, said at the seminar that the DPRK would certainly attain the objective set forth in the joint editorial as all its people are closely united around their leader and it has precious experience, solid foundations of the independent national economy, ample scientists and technicians and abundant natural resources.
					
					 In particular, the powerful self-reliant defence capabilities built up under the great Songun politics of Kim Jong Il reliably guarantee the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and provide circumstances favorable for the economic development of the DPRK, he added.

articles.title: Embajador coreano en China aboga por firmar el convenio de paz
articles.content:
Embajador coreano en China aboga por firmar el convenio de paz
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ATCC) -- En relacion con la recien publicada declaracion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, tuvo lugar el dia 12 una conferencia de prensa en la embajada coreana en China.
					Tras informar la declaracion del MINREX, el embajador coreano recordo que gracias a los invariables y constantes esfuerzos del gobierno coreano, tuvieron lugar desde la decada de 1990 los dialogos para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, en el curso de los cuales se aprobaron importantes acuerdos bilaterales y multilaterales.
					
					Sin embargo, quedo a medio hacer la implementacion de todos esos acuerdos si no fueron invalidados por completo, lamento y subrayo que el proceso de las conversaciones a 6 bandas demuestra que no se podra resolver jamas el problema mientras no exista la confianza entre las partes interesadas.
					
					Al referirse a la conclusion sacada por la RPDC de que para volver a poner en su orbita el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, hay que prestar primordial atencion a la creacion de la confianza entre ella y Estados Unidos, responsables principales del problema nuclear, destaco, enumerando datos, la importancia de la firma del convenio de paz entre los dos paises.
					
					La firma de este convenio eliminara las relaciones hostiles RPDC-EE.UU. e impulsara activamente a buen ritmo la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, subrayo.
					
					El dialogo para la firma del convenio de paz podria abrirse por separado como lo establecido en la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre o en el marco de las conversaciones a 6 bandas para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, al igual que el dialogo RPDC-EE.UU. actualmente en marcha, en vista de su caracter e importancia, apunto.
					
					Si los paises responsables del Acuerdo de Armisticio desean de veras la paz, la seguridad y la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, deberan tomar la valiente decision de tratar el problema causal sin demorar mas el tiempo anteponiendo sus propios intereses, concluyo.

articles.title: Fuentes termales de la zona del monte Chilbo
articles.content:
Fuentes termales de la zona del monte Chilbo
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ATCC) -- Contribuyen mucho al fomento de la salud de las personas las fuentes termales que abundan en la zona del monte Chilbo situado en el distrito de Myongchon de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte de Corea.
					Segun el resultado de la reciente investigacion, existen 19 salidas de aguas terminales en 11 repartos como Hwangjin, Taho, Manho y Sari.
					
					Once de esas 19 son fuentes de azufre que contienen en un litro mas de 2 miligramos de este elemento.
					
					Segun la composicion quimica, esas once se clasifican en 5 fuentes de azufre simple, 4 de hidrocarbonato sulfurico y 2 de sal compuesta.
					
					La fuente de azufre es eficaz para el tratamiento de la dermatosis, las enfermedades del sistema nervioso, las ginecologicas, la toxicosis cronica de metal pesado, los males de los sistemas digestivo, urinario y sanguineo, los problemas de metabolismo, etc.
					
					En la zona del monte Chilbo se construyeron las vistosas "aldeas de sanatorios", en particular, la de la fuente de Hwangjin, y las "modernas viviendas para el tratamiento" que facilitan a los trabajadores suficientes condiciones para tomar la hidroterapia.

articles.title: Pueblo coreano avanza con vigor hacia futuro
articles.content:
Pueblo coreano  avanza con vigor hacia futuro
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ATCC) -- En acato al editorial conjunto de los periodicos principales de Corea publicado con motivo del Ano Nuevo, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, llenos de conviccion y optimismo, aceleran desde principios del ano la solemne marcha hacia el radiante porvenir para  convertir el presente ano del aniversario 65 de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en el ano de grandes cambios que se registrara con letras mayusculas en la historia de la construccion de una gran potencia prospera.
					Miles y miles de militares y civiles, quienes han luchado guardando en su corazon la verdad eterna de que si siguen al Dirigente Kim Jong Il podran anticipar la felicidad del futuro mas radiante, realizan a cada momento de su vida los relevantes meritos acordando la palpitacion de su corazon al mundo de la abnegacion patriotica del Dirigente.
					
					La consigna "!Vivir no para hoy, sino para manana!" sirve del lema de vida y lucha, que enarbolan invariablemente el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea tanto hoy como manana.
					
					En esta consigna presentada por el Dirigente en la obra del 14 de enero del 85 (1996) de la Era Juche esta reflejado el sublime proposito de vivir con la decision de dedicar toda la vida para el futuro de la patria y la felicidad de las generaciones venideras aunque si mismo no disfrutara de placer.
					
					Gracias a que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea  poseen este punto de vista de vida revolucionaria,  pudieron recorrer por el unico camino del socialismo superando victoriosamente la "marcha penosa", la forzada durante mas de 10 anos pasados  y preparar un trampolin para saltar a la posicion de una gran potencia prospera.
					
					En el periodo tan dificil en lo economico, se realizo con exito el arreglo de la tierra, causa patriotica para la eternidad, y se construyeron por doquier del pais numerosas plantas electricas,  las bases productivas que hacen gala como modelos de la modernizacion y las creaciones monumentales.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, quienes han experimentado de siglo en siglo la verdad de que no hay miel sin hiel,  avanzan con vigor y conviccion de abrir plenamente sin falta las puertas a la gran potencia prospera hasta el ano 2012, en que se celebrara el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Llego el tiempo de tratar problema causal, insiste Minju Joson
articles.content:
Llego el tiempo de tratar problema causal, insiste Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ATCC) -- Ahora es cuando todos, tanto los responsables principales como los paises interesados, deben dar una coyuntura decisiva para la eliminacion de las relaciones hostiles entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos al tratar el problema causal en aras de la paz, la seguridad y la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					El gobierno de la RPDC concedio gran importancia a la firma del convenio de paz con EE.UU. porque ha sacado una clara conclusion a base del balance de todo el proceso de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					Resulta obvio para todos que no se puede resolver el problema de las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU., ya que este imperio abriga la intencion hostil de no coexistir jamas con la primera y de aplastarla a toda costa.
					
					Si bien tuvieron lugar hasta ahora varias rondas de las conversaciones a 6 bandas para la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana, ellas han sido frustradas y fracasadas repetidamente. Esto es el resultado inevitable de que EE.UU., responsable directo de la solucion del tema, no elimina su hostilidad a la RPDC.
					
					Por esta razon, la RPDC atribuyo la importancia primeramente a la creacion de la confianza entre si y EE.UU., responsables principales del problema nuclear, como medida previa para revitalizar el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					En la creacion de las relaciones de tal confianza no hay otra alternativa mas eficiente y constructiva que sustituir el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea por el convenio de paz.
					
					Si ambas partes logran hacerlo, se producira una innovacion radical en la creacion de la confianza y esto les convendria para llegar a los consensos tras intercambiar francamente sus opiniones acerca de los problemas pendientes.  
					
					De esta manera, se dara la coyuntura decisiva en la empresa para preservar la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.
